AMAZON IS FINE WITH SCAMMING YOU. Amazon has a feature where they'll show cheaper "like new" products next to whatever you're shopping. Both times I've purchased like new I've been scammed. First I was sent the right box for the item, but with a cheap knock-off version. Second time I got socks instead of the electronic device I ordered. What makes this even better is it takes over half a month for a refund. And what's worse is that it's only in Amazon credit. Shop ebay if you're buying like new.

I used to love Amazon Prime. I started a subscription because of one of their big advertising pushes--2-day delivery. Thing is, that's a marketing gimmick that doesn't work 99 percent of the time. So, if that appeals to you as a reason to pay for a monthly subscription, be advised that you will almost NEVER actually get the item in two days. You will get a 2-day delivery date at time of order, then you'll get an apology that says it's delayed. It should be Prime 5 or 6-day delivery.
